course_name: Python for Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering - Learn Interactively
course_overview:
In this course, you will learn about the Python programming language in the context of mechanical and aerospace engineering. 

You will start with the basics of Python, like variables, collections, and different types of loops. Once you have the basics out of the way, the real fun begins. You will learn how to: graph thrust available and thrust required, graph dynamic pressure during a rocket launch, and how to plot airfoil coordinates. 

Towards the end, you will get a strong overview of orbital parameters and learn how to model both 2D and 3D static orbits. Once youâ€™ve completed this course, you will have a better understanding of Python and how it works in the context of mechanical/aerospace engineering.
course_folder: python for mechanical and aerospace engineering
course_lessons: 0-introduction to python for mechanical and aerospace engineering
6-introduction to fizzbuzz and writing a python program
11-thrust available and thrust required at sea level
12-thrust available and thrust required at 10000 ft
13-thrust available and thrust required at fl350
15-introduction to rocket launches and dynamic pressure
22-conclusion for rocket launches and dynamic pressure
44-interacting with excel and finishing the program
45-conclusion for web scraping and saving to excel
